Title: Head of Accounting – in Heidelberg, Germany
Content:
We are Europe’s flagship research laboratory for the life sciences – an intergovernmental organisation performing scientific research in disciplines including molecular biology, physics, chemistry and computer science. We are an international, innovative and interdisciplinary laboratory with more than 1700 employees from many nations, operating across six sites, in Heidelberg (HQ), Barcelona, Hinxton near Cambridge, Hamburg, Grenoble and Rome.

Reporting directly to the Head of Finance, the Head of Accounting is responsible for preparation of the annual accounts and all financial and management reporting within EMBL. The postholder manages a team of approx. 10 qualified and part qualified accountants that cover all the main functions of a classic accounting department.



Your role*

Responsibilites include:

_Financial Reporting_



Management of all financial and management reporting processes
Management of the production of EMBL’s annual financial statement
Acting as the key contact point for EMBL’s external auditors
Acting as technical lead for all accounting matters
Maintaining and developing the SAP accounting system along with associated reporting systems (including financial aspects of Business Warehouse)


_Internal Control_



Management of the successful operation of all internal controls relevant to the accounting department and external financial reporting
Developing and optimising the effectiveness of internal controls within the accounting department and external financial reporting, consistent with the internal control environment in EMBL
Acting as key contact for internal audit for all matters pertaining to accounting


_Financial Transaction Processing_



Management of the processing of all financial transactions
Development and optimisation of all financial processing systems
Control of cash flow and treasury operations
Experience in driving change and related processes
Management of issues surrounding value-added and other relevant taxes
Dealing with financial and budgetary issues from management and scientific staff


_Staff Management_



Managing, training and developing accounting department staff


You will also be expected to establish a good working relationship with other departments within EMBL and its sites as well as with internal and external auditors. As Head of Accounting, you might be appointed to deputise for the Head of Finance.



You have*


As our ideal candidate, you will have a recognised qualification as Chartered Accountant and a minimum of 5 years post qualification experience in a similar role. You will need to demonstrate a successful history of staff and organisation management and how you have developed and motivated a successful team. Organisational skills combined with high service orientation and the ability to work independently and communicate effectively are required. Key to success in the role will be effective and transparent communication, the ability to persuade and influence and a sound understanding of technical accounting, financial processes and reporting. A sound knowledge of SAP FI/CO or similar is essential. Furthermore, excellent IT skills particularly Excel are a pre-requisite. Excellent working knowledge of English is essential for this position.



You might also have*


Previous experience of working in an international organisation or an organisation engaged in research would be an advantage. Knowledge of German, French and/or Spanish language is an advantage.



Why join us*


EMBL is an inclusive, equal opportunity employer offering attractive conditions and benefits appropriate to an international research organisation with a very collegial and family friendly working environment. The remuneration package comprises a competitive salary, a comprehensive pension scheme, medical, educational and other social benefits, as well as financial support for relocation and installation, including your family.



What else you need to know*


Please note that appointments on fixed term contracts can be renewed, depending on circumstances at the time of the review.

If you feel you have the right skills and experience, please apply online through: https://www.embl.org/jobs/position/HD01792/ submitting your CV and cover letter.
